page.title: 08RALEGH'S CROSS
page.content: The pub at Ralegh's Cross provides a social centre for the area. Meals are provided and it is open for morning coffee (40p a cup - a very good coffee served in willow pattern cups). There is also a small amount of accomodation. The pub has been modernised and appears to be very popular with both the locals and with tourists. I didnt see a stittle alley, dart board or snooker table. The food looked good, golden scampi and chips for Â£3.95, Â£2.15 for cod and chips and 75p for strawberries and cream. In the field next to the pub at Ralegh's Cross there used to be an open air market and a sheep fair every autumn. However this was last held in 1984 as the demand for it fell off and sheep are now sent to the larger markets such as that in Taunton.
